bibl.title: Charles W. Sawyer v. T.J. Hamilton. Application for release
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the 3rd Judicial District of Washington

body.p: In the District Court holding terms at Seattle.
In the application of Chas. W. Sawyer for release upon } 5425 writ of Habeas Corpus

Now on this 14th day of July 1887 comes before me Richard A. Jones Judge of said Court. T.J. Hamilton United States Marshal for Washington Territory and in to the writ of habeas corpus heretofore issued herein make return of said court and issued herein produces the body of said Chas. W. Sawyer together with the cause of his detention in custody and the application of said Sawyer for discharge from arrest being heard by me and it appearing from the returns of said Marshal that said Sawyer is held in custody by virtue of an arrest made by said Marshal under a warrant issued by James L. Ludlow, M.D. Commissioner to whom had been presented a duly certified transcript and exemplification of an indictment found and against said Chas. W. Sawyer in

the United States District Court for the Northern District of California and legal cause for the detention of said Sawyer duly appearing. Said application of said Sawyer is denied and he is hereby remanded to the custody of said United States Marshal to be dealt with according to the law
In the application of Chas. W. Sawyer for release upon Writ of Habeas Corpus
James Seavey, Clerk. By. W.E. Ledgerwood, Deputy Clerk.
